Édouard Goursat.label: Edouard Goursat
Édouard Goursat.description: Édouard Jean-Baptiste Goursat was a French mathematician, now remembered principally as an expositor for his Cours d'analyse mathématique, which appeared in the first decade of the twentieth century. Wikipedia
Books: A Course in Mathematical Analysis Volume 1 Derivatives and Differentials; Definite Integrals; Expansion in Series; Applications to Geometry
A Course in Mathematical Analysis Derivatives and Differentials
A Course in Mathematical Analysis Volume 3 Variation of Solutions; Partial Differential Equations of the Second Order; Integral Equations; Calc
A Course in Mathematical Analysis pt. 1. Variation of solutions. Partial differential equations of the second order
A Course in Mathematical Analysis pt. 1. Functions of a complex variableMore

Édouard Chatton.label: Édouard Chatton
Édouard Chatton.description: Édouard Chatton was a French biologist who first characterized the distinction between the eukaryotic and prokaryotic systems of cellular organization. Wikipedia

Étienne Laspeyres.label: Étienne Laspeyres
Étienne Laspeyres.description: Ernst Louis Étienne Laspeyres was Professor ordinarius of economics and statistics or State Sciences and cameralistics in Basel, Riga, Dorpat, Karlsruhe, and finally for 26 years in Gießen. Wikipedia

Abhay Ashtekar.label: Abhay Ashtekar
Abhay Ashtekar.description: Abhay Vasant Ashtekar is an Indian theoretical physicist. He is the Eberly Professor of Physics and the Director of the Institute for Gravitational Physics and Geometry at Pennsylvania State University. Wikipedia

Abraham Haskel Taub.label: Abraham Haskel Taub
Abraham Haskel Taub.description: Abraham Haskel Taub was a distinguished American mathematician and physicist, well known for his important contributions to the early development of general relativity, as well as differential geometry and differential equations. Wikipedia

Étienne Lenoir.label: Étienne Lenoir
Étienne Lenoir.description: Jean Joseph Étienne Lenoir also known as Jean J. Lenoir was a Belgian engineer who developed the internal combustion engine in 1858. Prior designs for such engines were patented as early as 1807, but none were commercially successful. Wikipedia

Abraham Klein (physicist).label: Abraham Klein
Abraham Klein (physicist).description: Abraham Klein was an American theoretical physicist. Klein studied at Brooklyn College and at Harvard University, where he made his 1948 master's degree and doctorate in 1950 under Julian Schwinger. Wikipedia
Abraham Klein (physicist).Born: January 10, 1927, Brooklyn, New York, United States

Abu Mansur Maturidi.label: Abu Mansur Maturidi
Abu Mansur Maturidi.description: Muhammad Abu Mansur al-Maturidi was an Persian Muslim theologian, and a scholar of Islamic jurisprudence and Qur'anic exegesis. Wikipedia

Abraham Vater.label: Abraham Vater
Abraham Vater.description:
Abraham Vater was a German anatomist from Wittenberg.
He received his doctorate in philosophy from the University of Wittenberg in 1706, and his medical degree from the University of Leipzig in 1710. Wikipedia

Adi Shamir.label: Adi Shamir
Adi Shamir.description: Adi Shamir is an Israeli cryptographer. He is a co-inventor of the RSA algorithm, a co-inventor of the Feige–Fiat–Shamir identification scheme, one of the inventors of differential cryptanalysis ... Wikipedia
Awards: Anna and Lajos Erdős Prize in Mathematics

Adam Ries.label: Adam Ries
Adam Ries.description: Adam Ries was a German mathematician. He is also known by the name Adam Riese. Wikipedia

Adolf Karl Ludwig Claus.label: Adolf Karl Ludwig Claus
Adolf Karl Ludwig Claus.description: Adolf Karl Ludwig Claus was a German chemist. He is known for his structure of benzene proposed in 1867. Wikipedia

Adriaan van den Spiegel.label: Adriaan van den Spiegel
Adriaan van den Spiegel.description: Adriaan van den Spiegel, name sometimes written as Adrianus Spigelius was a Flemish anatomist born in Brussels. For much of his career he practiced medicine in Padua, and is considered one of the great physicians associated with the city. Wikipedia

Aimé Argand.label: Aimé Argand
Aimé Argand.description: François Pierre Ami Argand was a Swiss physicist and chemist. He invented the Argand lamp, a great improvement on the traditional oil lamp. Wikipedia

Alan Guth.label: Alan Guth
Alan Guth.description: Alan Harvey Guth is an American theoretical physicist and cosmologist. Guth has researched elementary particle theory. Wikipedia
Alan Guth.Born: February 27, 1947 (age 67), New Brunswick, New Jersey, United States
Books: The Inflationary Universe The Quest for a New Theory of Cosmic Origins

Adolph Strümpell.label: Adolph Strümpell
Adolph Strümpell.description:
Ernst Adolf Gustav Gottfried von Strümpell was a Baltic German neurologist.
Strümpell was the son of philosopher Ludwig Strümpell. Wikipedia

Ada Yonath.label: Ada Yonath
Ada Yonath.description: Ada E. Yonath is an Israeli crystallographer best known for her pioneering work on the structure of the ribosome. Wikipedia
Awards: L'Oréal-UNESCO Awards for Women in Science
Albert Einstein World Award of Science
Paul Ehrlich and Ludwig Darmstaedter Prize

Adolf Sieverts.label: Adolf Sieverts
Adolf Sieverts.description: Adolf Ferdinand Sieverts was a German chemist, best known for his work on solubility of gases in metals. He originated Sieverts's law. Wikipedia

Adriaan Blaauw.label: Adriaan Blaauw
Adriaan Blaauw.description:
Adriaan Blaauw was a Dutch astronomer.
Blaauw was born in Amsterdam to Cornelis Blaauw and Gesina Clasina Zwart, and studied at Leiden University and the University of Groningen, obtaining his doctorate at the latter in 1946. Wikipedia

Alan Kotok.label: Alan Kotok
Alan Kotok.description: Alan Kotok was an American computer scientist known for his work at Digital Equipment Corporation and at the World Wide Web Consortium. Wikipedia

Alan S. Kaufman.label: Alan S. Kaufman
Alan S. Kaufman.description: Alan S. Kaufman is an American psychology professor known for his work on intelligence testing. Wikipedia

Albert L. Lehninger.label: Albert L. Lehninger
Albert L. Lehninger.description: Albert Lester Lehninger was an American biochemist in the field of bioenergetics. He made fundamental contributions to the current understanding of metabolism at a molecular level. Wikipedia
Books: The Mitochondrion Molecular Basis of Structure and Function
Biochemistry The Molecular Basis of Cell Structure and FunctionMore

Alexander Gelfond.label: Alexander Gelfond
Alexander Gelfond.description: Alexander Osipovich Gelfond was a Soviet mathematician. Gelfond's theorem is named after him. Wikipedia

Albert Ghiorso.label: Albert Ghiorso
Albert Ghiorso.description: Albert Ghiorso was an American nuclear scientist and co-discoverer of a record 12 chemical elements on the periodic table. His research career spanned five decades, from the early 1940s to the late 1990s. Wikipedia

Aleksander Wolszczan.label: Aleksander Wolszczan
Aleksander Wolszczan.description: Aleksander Wolszczan is a Polish astronomer. He is the co-discoverer of the first extrasolar planets and pulsar planets. Wikipedia

Adriaan Fokker.label: Adriaan Fokker
Adriaan Fokker.description:
Adriaan Daniël Fokker, was a Dutch physicist and musician.
Fokker was born in Buitenzorg, Dutch East Indies; he was a cousin of the aeronautical engineer Anthony Fokker. Wikipedia

Albert Adu Boahen.label: Albert Adu Boahen
Albert Adu Boahen.description: Albert Kwadwo Adu Boahen was a Ghanaian academic, historian, and politician. He was an academic at the University of Ghana from 1959 to 1990, since 1971 as a professor. Wikipedia

Albert W. Tucker.label: Albert W. Tucker
Albert W. Tucker.description: Albert William Tucker was a Canadian mathematician who made important contributions in topology, game theory, and non-linear programming. Wikipedia
Albert W. Tucker.Died: January 25, 1995, Hightstown, New Jersey, United States

Alexander Braun.label: Alexander Braun
Alexander Braun.description: Alexander Carl Heinrich Braun was a German botanist from Regensburg, Bavaria. His research centered on the morphology of plants. Wikipedia

Alexander Grothendieck.label: Alexander Grothendieck
Alexander Grothendieck.description: Alexander Grothendieck is a stateless mathematician born in Germany and raised in France, who is the central figure behind the creation of the modern theory of algebraic geometry. Wikipedia
Awards: Crafoord Prize in Astronomy and Mathematics

Alexander Davydov.label: Alexander Davydov
Alexander Davydov.description: Alexander Sergeevich Davydov was a Soviet and Ukrainian physicist. Davydov graduated from Moscow State University in 1939. In 1963-1990 he was Director of Institute for Theoretical Physics of the Ukrainian Academy of Sciences. Wikipedia

Alexander Dallas Bache.label: Alexander Dallas Bache
Alexander Dallas Bache.description: Alexander Dallas Bache was an American physicist, scientist and surveyor who erected coastal fortifications and conducted a detailed survey mapping of the United States coastline. Wikipedia
Alexander Dallas Bache.Died: February 17, 1867, Newport, Rhode Island, United States

Alexander Shulgin.label: Alexander Shulgin
Alexander Shulgin.description: Alexander "Sasha" Theodore Shulgin is an American medicinal chemist, biochemist, pharmacologist, psychopharmacologist, and author. Shulgin is credited with introducing MDMA to psychologists in the late 1970s for psychopharmaceutical use. Wikipedia

Alexander Stephan.label: Alexander Stephan
Alexander Stephan.description: Alexander Stephan is a German footballer who currently plays for 1. FC Nuremberg as a goalkeeper. Wikipedia

Alcide d'Orbigny.label: Alcide d'Orbigny
Alcide d'Orbigny.description: Alcide Charles Victor Marie Dessalines d'Orbigny was a French naturalist who made major contributions in many areas, including zoology, palaeontology, geology, archaeology and anthropology. Wikipedia

Alexander Ross Clarke.label: Alexander Ross Clarke
Alexander Ross Clarke.description:
Alexander Ross Clarke was a British geodesist, primarily remembered for his work defining different reference ellipsoids approximating the shape of the geoid and determining the Figure of the Earth.
Clarke was born in Reading, Berkshire, England. Wikipedia

Alexander Volberg.label: Alexander Volberg
Alexander Volberg.description: Alexander Volberg is a Russian mathematician. He is working in operator theory, complex analysis and harmonic analysis. He received the Salem Prize in 1988 for his work in harmonic analysis. Also he received the Lars Onsager medal in 2004. Wikipedia

Albert Hofmann.label: Albert Hofmann
Albert Hofmann.description: Albert Hofmann was a Swiss scientist known best for being the first person to synthesize, ingest, and learn of the psychedelic effects of lysergic acid diethylamide. Wikipedia

Aldo Castellani.label: Aldo Castellani
Aldo Castellani.description: Aldo Castellani was an Italian pathologist and bacteriologist. Wikipedia

Albert Brudzewski.label: Albert Brudzewski
Albert Brudzewski.description: Albert Brudzewski, also Albert Blar, Albert of Brudzewo or Wojciech Brudzewski was a Polish astronomer, mathematician, philosopher and diplomat. Wikipedia

Alexander Witting.label: Alexander Witting
Alexander Witting.description: Carl Johann Adolf Alexander Witting was a German mathematician. Wikipedia

Alfred Cort Haddon.label: Alfred Cort Haddon
Alfred Cort Haddon.description: Alfred Cort Haddon, Sc.D., FRS, FRGS was an influential British anthropologist and ethnologist. Initially a biologist, who achieved his most notable fieldwork, with W.H.R. Rivers, C.G. Wikipedia

Alexander Luria.label: Alexander Luria
Alexander Luria.description: Alexander Romanovich Luria was a famous Soviet neuropsychologist and developmental psychologist. He was one of the founders of Cultural-Historical Psychology, and a leader of the Vygotsky Circle. Wikipedia

Alexander du Toit.label: Alexander du Toit
Alexander du Toit.description: Alexander Logie du Toit FRS was a geologist from South Africa, and an early supporter of Alfred Wegener's theory of continental drift. Wikipedia
Education: Royal College of Science and Technology
The University of the Cape of Good Hope

Alfred Kirchhoff.label: Alfred Kirchhoff
Alfred Kirchhoff.description: Alfred Kirchhoff was a German geographer and naturalist. Wikipedia

Alan Sokal.label: Alan Sokal
Alan Sokal.description: Alan David Sokal is a professor of mathematics at University College London and professor of physics at New York University. He works in statistical mechanics and combinatorics. Wikipedia

Alfred Métraux.label: Alfred Metraux
Alfred Métraux.description: Alfred Métraux was a Swiss anthropologist and human rights leader. Wikipedia

Alfred Sturtevant.label: Alfred Sturtevant
Alfred Sturtevant.description: Alfred Henry Sturtevant was an American geneticist. Sturtevant constructed the first genetic map of a chromosome in 1913. Throughout his career he worked on the organism Drosophila melanogaster with Thomas Hunt Morgan. Wikipedia
Awards: John J. Carty Award for the Advancement of Science
National Medal of Science for Biological Sciences

Alfred Landé.label: Alfred Landé
Alfred Landé.description: Alfred Landé was a German-American physicist known for his contributions to quantum theory. He is responsible for the Landé g-factor and an explanation of the Zeeman Effect. Wikipedia

Alfred Aho.label: Alfred Aho
Alfred Aho.description: Alfred Vaino Aho is a Canadian computer scientist best known for his work on programming languages, compilers, and related algorithms, and his textbooks on the art and science of computer programming. Wikipedia

Alfred O. C. Nier.label: Alfred O. C. Nier
Alfred O. C. Nier.description: Alfred Otto Carl Nier was an American physicist who pioneered the development of mass spectrometry and used it in innovative ways to establish some major scientific results. Wikipedia
Alfred O. C. Nier.Born: May 28, 1911, Saint Paul, Minnesota, United States
Alfred O. C. Nier.Died: May 16, 1994, Hennepin County Medical Center, Minnesota, United States

Alexander Wetmore.label: Alexander Wetmore
Alexander Wetmore.description: Frank Alexander Wetmore was an American ornithologist and avian paleontologist. He was the sixth Secretary of the Smithsonian Institution. Wikipedia
Alexander Wetmore.Born: June 18, 1886, North Freedom, Wisconsin, United States
Alexander Wetmore.Died: December 7, 1978, Glen Echo, Maryland, United States
Books: The Birds of Haiti and the Dominican Republic
and Game Birds of North America
Song and Garden Birds of North AmericaMore

Alfred V. Kidder.label: Alfred V. Kidder
Alfred V. Kidder.description: Alfred Vincent Kidder was an American archaeologist considered the foremost of the southwestern United States and Mesoamerica during the first half of the 20th century. Wikipedia

Alfred Pringsheim.label: Alfred Pringsheim
Alfred Pringsheim.description: Alfred Pringsheim was a German mathematician and patron of the arts. He was born in Ohlau, Prussian Silesia and died in Zürich, Switzerland. Wikipedia

Amos de-Shalit.label: Amos de-Shalit
Amos de-Shalit.description: Amos de-Shalit was a distinguished Israeli nuclear physicist. Wikipedia

Allan Sandage.label: Allan Sandage
Allan Sandage.description: Allan Rex Sandage was an American astronomer. He was Staff Member Emeritus with the Carnegie Observatories in Pasadena, California. Wikipedia
Allan Sandage.Born: June 18, 1926, Iowa City, Iowa, United States
Allan Sandage.Died: November 13, 2010, San Gabriel, California, United States
Books: Centennial History Of The Carnegie Institution Of Washington
Awards: Gold Medal of the Royal Astronomical Society
National Medal of Science for Physical Science
Crafoord Prize in Astronomy and MathematicsMore

Allen J. Bard.label: Allen J. Bard
Allen J. Bard.description: Allen Joseph Bard is an American chemist. He is the Hackerman-Welch Regents Chair Professor of chemistry and director of the Center for Electrochemistry at the University of Texas at Austin. Wikipedia
Allen J. Bard.Born: December 18, 1933 (age 80), New York City, New York, United States
Awards: National Medal of Science for Chemistry

Amos Eaton.label: Amos Eaton
Amos Eaton.description: Amos Eaton was an American botanist, geologist, and educator who is considered the founder of the modern scientific prospectus in education, which was a radical departure from the American liberal arts ... Wikipedia
Amos Eaton.Died: May 10, 1842, Troy, New York, United States

Amotz Zahavi.label: Amotz Zahavi
Amotz Zahavi.description: Amotz Zahavi is an Israeli evolutionary biologist, a Professor Emeritus at the Zoology Department of Tel Aviv University, and one of the founders of the Society for the Protection of Nature in Israel. Wikipedia

Alpheus Hyatt.label: Alpheus Hyatt
Alpheus Hyatt.description: Alpheus Hyatt was an American zoologist and palaeontologist. Wikipedia

Anatole Abragam.label: Anatole Abragam
Anatole Abragam.description: Anatole Abragam was a French physicist who wrote The Principles of Nuclear Magnetism and has made significant contributions to the field of nuclear magnetic resonance. Wikipedia
Books: Electron paramagnetic resonance of transition ions

Amos Tversky.label: Amos Tversky
Amos Tversky.description: Amos Nathan Tversky was a cognitive and mathematical psychologist, a student of cognitive science, a collaborator of Daniel Kahneman, and a figure in the discovery of systematic human cognitive bias and handling of risk. Wikipedia
Books: Judgment Under Uncertainty Heuristics and Biases

Anatoly Petrovich Alexandrov.label: Anatoly Petrovich Alexandrov
Anatoly Petrovich Alexandrov.description: Anatoly Petrovich Alexandrov was a Soviet and Russian physicist, director of the Kurchatov Institute, academician and president of the Academy of Sciences of the USSR. Wikipedia

Andreas Sigismund Marggraf.label: Andreas Sigismund Marggraf
Andreas Sigismund Marggraf.description: Andreas Sigismund Marggraf was a German chemist from Berlin, then capital of the Margraviate of Brandenburg, and a pioneer of analytical chemistry. He isolated zinc in 1746 by heating calamine and carbon. Wikipedia

Andre Geim.label: Andre Geim
Andre Geim.description: Sir Andre Konstantin Geim, FRS is a Russian-born Dutch-British physicist working at the University of Manchester. Geim was awarded the 2010 Nobel Prize in Physics jointly with Konstantin Novoselov for his work on graphene. Wikipedia
Awards: John J. Carty Award for the Advancement of ScienceMore
Education: Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology

Annie Montague Alexander.label: Annie Montague Alexander
Annie Montague Alexander.description: Annie Montague Alexander was an American philanthropist and paleontological collector. She established the University of California Museum of Paleontology, Museum of Vertebrate Zoology, and financed ... Wikipedia

Andrew Ure.label: Andrew Ure
Andrew Ure.description: Andrew Ure was a Scottish doctor, scholar and chemist. Wikipedia
Books: Dictionary of Chemistry on the Basis of MR Nicholson's in Which the Principles of the Science Are Investigated Anew and Its Applications to the Phenomena of Nature
Moral and Commercial Economy of the Factory System of Great Britain
The Cotton Manufacture of Great Britain Systematically Investigated -More

Archibald Reiss.label: Archibald Reiss
Archibald Reiss.description:
Archibald Rudolph Reiss was a German-Swiss criminology-pioneer, forensic scientist, professor and writer.
The Reiss family was in agriculture and winemaking. Wikipedia

Arnold Eucken.label: Arnold Eucken
Arnold Eucken.description: Arnold Eucken was a German chemist and physicist. Wikipedia

Antoine Lacroix.label: Antoine Lacroix
Antoine Lacroix.description:
Antoine François Alfred Lacroix ForMemRS was a French mineralogist and geologist. He was born at Mâcon, Saône-et-Loire.
He took the degree of D. s Sc. in Paris, 1889, as student of Ferdinand André Fouqué. Wikipedia

André Lichnerowicz.label: André Lichnerowicz
André Lichnerowicz.description: André Lichnerowicz was a noted French differential geometer and mathematical physicist of Polish descent. Wikipedia
Books: Magnetohydrodynamics--waves and shock waves in curved space-time

Arthur Birch (organic chemist).label: Arthur Birch
Arthur Birch (organic chemist).description:
Arthur John Birch, AC was an organic chemist from Australia.
Birch developed the Birch reduction of aromatic rings which is widely used in synthetic organic chemistry. The Birch Reduction enables the modification of steroids. Wikipedia

Anja Feldmann.label: Anja Feldmann
Anja Feldmann.description: Anja Feldmann is a German computer scientist. Wikipedia

Arnaud Denjoy.label: Arnaud Denjoy
Arnaud Denjoy.description:
Arnaud Denjoy was a French mathematician.
Denjoy was born in Auch, Gers. His contributions include work in harmonic analysis and differential equations. His integral was the first to be able to integrate all derivatives. Wikipedia

Arnold Walfisz.label: Arnold Walfisz
Arnold Walfisz.description: Arnold Walfisz was a Polish mathematician working in analytic number theory. Wikipedia

Arthur Wieferich.label: Arthur Wieferich
Arthur Wieferich.description: Arthur Josef Alwin Wieferich was a German mathematician and teacher, remembered for his work on number theory. Wikipedia

Arthur Ernest Guedel.label: Arthur Ernest Guedel
Arthur Ernest Guedel.description: Arthur Ernest Guedel was an American anesthesiologist. He was known for his studies on the uptake and distribution of inhalational anesthetics, as well for defining the various stages of general anesthesia. Wikipedia
Arthur Ernest Guedel.Born: June 13, 1883, Cambridge City, Indiana, United States

Arthur Jeffrey Dempster.label: Arthur Jeffrey Dempster
Arthur Jeffrey Dempster.description: Arthur Jeffrey Dempster was a Canadian-American physicist best known for his work in mass spectrometry and his discovery of the uranium isotope 235U. Wikipedia

Ashley Montagu.label: Ashley Montagu
Ashley Montagu.description: Montague Francis Ashley-Montagu was a British-American anthropologist who popularized topics such as race and gender and their relation to politics and development. He was the rapporteur, in 1950, for the UNESCO statement The Race Question. Wikipedia
Ashley Montagu.Died: November 26, 1999, Princeton, New Jersey, United States

Arne Beurling.label: Arne Beurling
Arne Beurling.description: Arne Carl-August Beurling was a Swedish mathematician and professor of mathematics at Uppsala University and later at the Institute for Advanced Study in Princeton, New Jersey. Wikipedia

Arthur Eddington.label: Arthur Stanley Eddington
Arthur Eddington.description: Sir Arthur Stanley Eddington, OM, FRS was a British astronomer, physicist, and mathematician of the early 20th century who did his greatest work in astrophysics. He was also a philosopher of science and a popularizer of science. Wikipedia
Awards: Gold Medal of the Royal Astronomical Society

Ashoke Sen.label: Ashoke Sen
Ashoke Sen.description: Ashoke Sen, FRS is an Indian theoretical physicist and distinguished professor at the Harish-Chandra Research Institute, Allahabad. He also is the Morningstar Visiting professor at MIT. His main area of work is String Theory. Wikipedia
Education: State University of New York at Stony BrookMore

August Freund.label: August Freund
August Freund.description: August Freund was an Austrian chemist. In 1881 he discovered the mechanism for synthesising cyclopropane. The method now bears his name. Wikipedia

August Kundt.label: August Kundt
August Kundt.description: August Adolf Eduard Eberhard Kundt was a German physicist. Wikipedia

Auguste Forel.label: Auguste Forel
Auguste Forel.description: Auguste-Henri Forel was a Swiss myrmecologist, neuroanatomist and psychiatrist, notable for his investigations into the structure of the human brain and that of ants. For example, he is considered a co-founder of the neuron theory. Wikipedia
Books: The Sexual Question - The Original Classic Edition
Ants and Some Other Insects An Inquiry Into the Psychic Powers of These Animals
with an Appendix on the Peculiarities of Their Olfactory SenseMore

August Gottlieb Richter.label: August Gottlieb Richter
August Gottlieb Richter.description:
August Gottlieb Richter was a German surgeon, born in Zörbig, Saxony.
He received his doctorate from the University of Göttingen in 1764, and spent most of his subsequent career in Göttingen as a professor and surgeon. Wikipedia

Augustus Radcliffe Grote.label: Augustus Radcliffe Grote
Augustus Radcliffe Grote.description:
Augustus Radcliffe Grote was a British entomologist who worked mainly in America.
Grote investigated, discovered and designated various butterflies and moths in North America, particularly in the USA, Mexico and Cuba. Wikipedia

Augusto Gansser-Biaggi.label: Augusto Gansser-Biaggi
Augusto Gansser-Biaggi.description: Augusto Gansser-Biaggi was a Swiss geologist who specialised in the geology of the Himalayas. He was born in Milan. Wikipedia

Augusto Righi.label: Augusto Righi
Augusto Righi.description: Augusto Righi was an Italian physicist and a pioneer in the study of electromagnetism. He was born and died in Bologna. Wikipedia

Ben Carson.label: Ben Carson
Ben Carson.description: Benjamin Solomon "Ben" Carson, Sr., is a columnist and retired American neurosurgeon. He is credited with being the first surgeon to successfully separate conjoined twins joined at the head. Wikipedia
Books: America the Beautiful Rediscovering What Made This Nation Great

Aziz Suryal Atiya.label: Aziz Suryal Atiya
Aziz Suryal Atiya.description: Professor Aziz Suryal Atiya was a prominent Coptologist who was a Coptic historian and scholar and an expert in Islamic and Crusades studies. Wikipedia

Axel Thue.label: Axel Thue
Axel Thue.description:
Axel Thue, was a Norwegian mathematician, known for highly original work in diophantine approximation, and combinatorics.
He stated in 1914 the so-called word problem for semigroups or Thue problem, closely related to the halting problem. Wikipedia

Baron Wilhelm von Biela.label: Baron Wilhelm von Biela
Baron Wilhelm von Biela.description:
Baron Wilhelm von Biela was a German-Austrian military officer and amateur astronomer.
Wilhelm von Biela was born in Roßla, Harz. Wikipedia

Benjamin Apthorp Gould.label: Benjamin Apthorp Gould
Benjamin Apthorp Gould.description: Benjamin Apthorp Gould was a pioneering American astronomer. He is noted for creating the Astronomical Journal, discovering the Gould Belt, and for founding of the Argentine National Observatory and the Argentine National Weather Service. Wikipedia
Books: Report on the History of the Discovery of Neptune

Ben Shneiderman.label: Ben Shneiderman
Ben Shneiderman.description: Ben Shneiderman is an American computer scientist, and professor for Computer Science at the University of Maryland Human-Computer Interaction Lab at the University of Maryland, College Park. Wikipedia
Ben Shneiderman.Born: August 21, 1947 (age 66), New York City, New York, United States
Education: The Bronx High School of Science
State University of New York at Stony Brook

Barys Kit.label: Barys Kit
Barys Kit.description: Boris Kit is an American rocket scientist. Wikipedia

Beniamino Segre.label: Beniamino Segre
Beniamino Segre.description: Beniamino Segre was an Italian mathematician who is remembered today as a major contributor to algebraic geometry and one of the founders of combinatorial geometry. Wikipedia

Bartel Leendert van der Waerden.label: Bartel Leendert van der Waerden
Bartel Leendert van der Waerden.description: Bartel Leendert van der Waerden was a Dutch mathematician and historian of mathematics. Wikipedia

Avraham Biran.label: Avraham Biran
Avraham Biran.description: Avraham Biran was an Israeli archaeologist, best known for heading excavations at Tel Dan in northern Israel. He headed the Institute of Archaeology at Hebrew Union College in Jerusalem for many years. Wikipedia
